description:
Hi,

Description
===========

I have installed Openstack Mitaka release manually and getting following error. Please find nova-api error log attached. 

root@con:/home/con# neutron net-list
+--------------------------------------+-------------+------------------------------------------------------+
| id                                   | name        | subnets                                              |
+--------------------------------------+-------------+------------------------------------------------------+
| a5bf7834-7f5f-4c64-ad00-8c40cbc72227 | provider    | 229751f3-b983-4c09-a07b-9c16d0d35e59 192.168.57.0/24 |
| 4bf2a174-8d35-4306-97f5-acf015637a12 | selfservice | 87085446-68b4-400a-9158-012b20aaeb71 172.16.1.0/24   |
+--------------------------------------+-------------+------------------------------------------------------+
root@con:/home/con# openstack server create --flavor m1.tiny --image cirros --nic net-id=4bf2a174-8d35-4306-97f5-acf015637a12 --security-group default --key-name mykey selfservice-instance
Unexpected API Error. Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible.
<class 'oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError'> (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-fafcfa29-dcb9-4c33-a8ea-aee09963cf5f)
root@con:/home/con# 
root@con:/home/con# 
root@con:/home/con# 

Steps to reproduce

Install Openstack Mitaka release from following guide

http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/install-guide-ubuntu/launch-instance-selfservice.html

Expected result
===============
All verification while installation for all components was successful. Instance should launch successfully. 

Actual result
=============
Getting above error. 

Environment
===========
Mitaka - Manual Installation. 

Logs & Configs
==============

nova-api logs attached.
title: Unable to launch Instance with Mitaka - Unexpected API Error

comments.content:
Hi,

Description
===========

I have installed Openstack Mitaka release manually and getting following error. Please find nova-api error log attached. 

root@con:/home/con# neutron net-list
+--------------------------------------+-------------+------------------------------------------------------+

+--------------------------------------+-------------+------------------------------------------------------+

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~kk-openstack

comments.content:
Hi,

Check once you have added this line (enabled_apis= osapi_compute,metadata ) in DEFAULT section of /etc/nova/nova.conf file
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~venkatamaheshkotha

comments.content:
Hi Kuldeep,

uncomment enabled_apis= osapi_compute,metadata line in [DEFAULT] section and 
comment out auth_plugin=<None> in Neutron section of /etc/nova/nova.conf file.

or 

Edit /etc/nova/nova.conf file such as 
[DEFAULT]
enabled_apis= osapi_compute,metadata
[neutron]
#auth_plugin=<None>
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~r+

comments.content: This is an invalid setup, you have ec2 in the enabled_apis config option, which isn't supported in mitaka. If the docs say to do that, then this is a docs bug and should be redirected.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Hi Rishabh,

I am already having the same config in 

[DEFAULT]
dhcpbridge_flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf
dhcpbridge=/usr/bin/nova-dhcpbridge
state_path=/var/lib/nova
lock_path=/var/lock/nova
force_dhcp_release=True
libvirt_use_virtio_for_bridges=True
verbose=True
ec2_private_dns_show_ip=True
api_paste_config=/etc/nova/api-paste.ini
enabled_apis=osapi_compute,metadata
rpc_backend = rabbit
auth_strategy = keystone
my_ip = 10.0.0.11
use_neutron = True
firewall_driver = nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver


Also couldn't see ec2 enable option. I am still getting this error?

Also while browsing existing bugs I could see it can relate to this 
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1574988

Is these changes available in latest release? or how to apply this commit?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~kk-openstack
